channel.title: I think iv found the runescape servers
channel.description:
ok i downloaded bind then it had nsllokup inside so i ran it and it said type a host so i did uk3.runescape.com and it came up with this
server:62.31.144.39 address:62.31.144.39.39#53
non-authoritative answer: name: uk3.runescape.com address:217.138.31.252
what does this mean is it the servers is it hackable????

item.source: I think iv found the runescape servers

item.title: I think iv found the runescape servers
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

[17:49:45] * Dns resolved uk3.runescape.com to 217.138.31.252

That’s just their IP address. Every server has one. Yes, it’s the server. Is it hackable? Possibly. Is it even worth trying? No.

What you found was just the IP address of the server. That’s where the server is. An IP address is the actual address, the text (uk3.runescape.com) is simply an easier way to handle it that a bunch of crazy numbers. All you did was find the real address of the server, not the name that simply forwards it to that address.

Read full topic
item.source: I think iv found the runescape servers
